content: // ä¸€æ¬¡æ€§å†™å…¥ if err := os.WriteFile("file.txt", []byte("Hello GOSAMPLES!"), 0666); err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } // é€è¡Œå†™å…¥ package main import ( "log" "os" ) var lines = []string{ "Go", "is", "the", "best", "programming", "language", "in", "the", "world", } func main() { // create file f, err := os.Create("file.txt") if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } // remember to close the file defer f.Close() for _, line := range lines { _, err := f.WriteString(line + "\n") if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } } } // å†™å…¥byte package main import ( "log" "os" ) var bytes = []byte{ 0x47, // G 0x4f, // O 0x20, // <space> 0x20, // <space> 0x20, // <space> 0x50, // P 0x4c, // L 0x45, // E 0x53, // S } var additionalBytes = []byte{ 0x53, // S 0x41, // A 0x4d, // M } func main() { // create file f, err := os.Create("file.txt") if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } // remember to close the file defer f.Close() // write bytes to the file _, err = f.Write(bytes) if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } // write additional bytes to the file, start at index 2 _, err = f.WriteAt(additionalBytes, 2) if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } } // ç¼“å†²æ–¹å¼å†™å…¥ package main import ( "bufio" "log" "os" ) var lines = []string{ "Go", "is", "the", "best", "programming", "language", "in", "the", "world", } func main() { // create file f, err := os.Create("file.txt") if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } // remember to close the file defer f.Close() // create new buffer buffer := bufio.NewWriter(f) for _, line := range lines { _, err := buffer.WriteString(line + "\n") if err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } } // flush buffered data to the file if err := buffer.Flush(); err != nil { log.Fatal(err) } }
